3.3.2 Data snapshot details

Click a snapshot listed in the data snapshot management home to display information about the data snapshot, including the Hive table name, number of lines, data size, and the values contained in the snapshot.

  1. Name: Dataset used by the snapshot.

  2. Success rate: Rate of records stored in the Hive table successfully.

    • Valid: Rate of records stored in the Hive table successfully because all column types match.

    • Mismatched: Rate of records failed to be stored in the Hive table because column types do not match.

    • Missing: Rate of missing records

  3. Snapshot data values: Displays the data values captured in the snapshot.

  4. Database: Name of the Hive database in which the snapshot is stored.

  5. Table: Name of the Hive table in which the snapshot is stored.

  6. Summary: Number of rows (records) and columns of the dataset captured in the snapshot.

  7. Elapsed time: Elapsed time to capture the data.

  8. Created: Displays when the snapshot was created.

  9. Dataflow: Displays the dataflow used to create the snapshot. Click on it to view/edit the dataflow.

  10. Dataset: Displays the wrangled dataset from which the snapshot was created. Click on it to view/edit the dataset.

  11. Origin imported dataset: Displays the imported dataset (source data) from which the snapshot was created.

Parent topic: 3.3 Data snapshot
